checks.label: Duplicate payment verification
checks.detail: 137 high-confidence groups (£510.7K). Duplicate ratio: 0.4%. Filtered out: 5 batch payments, 1147 CSV overlaps.

checks.label: Split payment analysis
checks.detail: 11 suspect instances (£5.1M, 1.4% of spend). Threshold: 5+ payments to same supplier in same week, 80%+ of approval limit.

checks.label: Year-end spike verification
checks.detail: Highest spike: 5.7x in unknown dept. Year-end spikes are common in public sector (capital programmes, grants). Only extreme spikes (>3x) warrant concern.

checks.label: CH breach temporal verification
checks.detail: 2 suppliers with £6.6K confirmed during active breach periods. Enrichment errors excluded. Only dated violations with confirmed overlap flagged.

checks.label: Cross-council price comparison
checks.detail: 13 shared suppliers found. 4 with >200% price gap (requiring 3+ transactions each side). Extreme disparities (>10,000%) filtered as different service scopes.

checks.label: Benford's Law forensic screening
checks.detail: Significant deviation from Benford's Law (p < 0.001). χ²=2541.29 on 25490 amounts >£100. Largest deviation: digit 5 (5.0% off expected).

warnings: CRITICAL: Only 0.0% of transactions have descriptions. This severely limits analysis quality.
4 suppliers show >200% price disparity after filtering. These are more likely genuine value concerns than extreme outliers.

Benford's Law analysis shows significant deviation (χ²=2541.29). Digit 5 deviates 5.0% from expected. This warrants investigation but can also occur with legitimate round-number grants or threshold-based payments.
